title: Drawing, "Interior in the House of Lord Chamberlain O'Neill, Strandraede, Copenhagen", 1844
medium: Pen and brush and black ink,  watercolor, graphite on paper
signed: Signed and dated in black ink, lower left corner:  Zeuthen 1844
provenance: Sotheby's Arcade, NY, Old Master and 19th Century European Art,  January 21, 2004, lot 244;  Eugene V. Thaw, New York
dimensions:
Frame H x W x D: 39.7 x 50.2 x 2.5 cm (15 5/8 in. x 19 3/4 in. x 1 in.)
Sheet: 21.6 x 31.8 cm (8 1/2 x 12 1/2 in.)
description: Sitting room in subdued tones of gray, plaster-work ceiling, a metal chandelier suspended from center.  At left, a sofa and three chairs form a conversation group around a pedestal table.  One woman sits on sofa, another stands to her left and leans on an armchair.  A group of portraits hang behind sofa.  A tall metal stove and fire screen at rear center.  Desk and chair in front of windows at right which are draped with red-and-white-stripped textile.  Parital view of room through open door at rear, left.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Interior in the House of Lord Chamberlain O'Neill, Strandraede, Copenhagen", 1844.Pen and brush and black ink,  watercolor, graphite on paper. Thaw Collection. 2012-5-3.
